I kept looking at this game. I kept thinking, "Ugh, I mean, it doesn't look that good, but it's tagged 'swordplay' which I like, and it's reviews are overwhelmingly positive..." so I bought it.

"Clone Drone in the Danger Zone" is my new favorite game. 

Let me clear up some things for people that I didn't know before I bought it:

• This is singleplayer. 

• it's like a gladiator swordfighting game. If I make it sound lame, it's way better than it sounds. 

• One cool thing to note is that it uses an upgrade system where after a fight, you can choose an upgrade from a skill tree.

I  would 100% reccommend this. Cool story, cool gameplay, cool music, everything. *Note: story mode is not complete. It is being worked on.*

Also there are two commentators who are pretty funny, Comment-a-tron and Analysis bot. They make a lot of robot-based jokes. 

tl;dr: This game is better than it looks, it's funny, has good singleplayer gameplay and other gamemodes once you finish the story. 8/10 would robot pun again.

38686493.review:
There's a lot more to this game than meets the eye, and not just the story, the combat too. It seems pretty straightforward at first: LMB for an overhead swing, A+LMB or D+LMB for a horizontal swing in that direction. If you swing around the same time and in the same direction as an enemy, you parry.

But then you can upgrade to have a bow. 

And then you can have a booster pack.

And then you can kick.

And then you can get a hammer.

The fighting is quick, fatal, and heaps of fun thanks to a simple and super effective fighting scheme and all the added weapons and bonuses you can upgrade yourself with. It reminds me a little of Jedi Academy/Outcast. This game is definitely worth it, even if the campaign is still WIP (But what's currently there is excellent) there's an endless/challenge mode and Workshop support. If you're a fan of sword-fighting games in any measure this is a must-buy!

38671523.review:
I really like Clone Drone In The Danger Zone. Most games like this bore me really fast but Clone Drone has held my attention for two campaign chapters and enocuraged me to make two maps. Really quickly I'll go through the big positives.

Pros:
Combat is fast, fluid, and easy to understand.
Killing enemies like Spidertron 6000 looks and feels great.
Game has a level editor.
Dismemberment looks and feels awesome.
Great upgrade system that allows new players to get what they need and lets veterans get what they want fast. The upgrade system doesn't hold you down or limit you.

Now for the cons. I should mention that I really like Clone Drone, however since the game is in early access it is flawed.

Cons:
Archers are annoying. Very annoying. You basically dance around them waiting for an opening.
The Level Editor is annoying. Consistent issues, no ease of use, limited enemies and a plethera of other problems.
You can't move your sword mid attack. On one hand I get it. every attack is commitment. one can't just spam attacks while frantically moving the mouse hoping to score a kill against a difficult sword enemy. However when fighting spidertrons hitting higher points on their legs is a total chore and hassle.
The duels are underwhelming. I remember my first 1v1 duel with a high level sword bot. I was excited, being a big fan of the combat system and wanting to see what high level ai could do to me. Well I jetpacked forward and killed it instantly. What a shame.
The Hammer. I hate the hammer. I understand the point of the hammer. However using the hammer is a chore. Using a hammer consists of beginning your swing while backing up from the approaching the enemy. After the hammer swing is ready move cloe to destroy the enemy. Don't get me wrong the hammer has its purpose but isn't as much fun as the laser sword or bow.
My final con is a big one: Optimization. The game for the most part runs fine on my 1060 6gb and 3.5 ghz 6 core cpu. However when I put in Fleet Overseers the game dipped to 20 fps when they used their laser attack.


Final Verdict:
All in all I've had a lot of fun with Clone Drone so far and expect to enjoy myself more in the future. While the game has its fair share of flaws the good outways the bad here. I give Clone Drone In The Danger Zone a 79/100.

38056012.review:
Ну что можно сказать о данной игре?... Хм... Да очень просто! Минимализм и "мясной" гейплей! Минимализм здесь в основном распространяется на графику, так как она тут очень проста и пойдет даже на средненьких компах. Но при этом здешний графен не режет глаз и производит довольно приятное впечатление, ведь все же любят пиксели, так?) Вся фишка и "мясо" этой игры, естественно, кроется в геймплее. А тут вам и незатейливая сюжетка, официальные челенджи и конечно же, самое важное - карты из мастерской! Очень здорово, что игре дали возможность существовать и в отрыве от поддержки разработчика и головы разных людей, придумывают, все более изощренные карты, бросая вызов проходящему. В игре присутствует достаточно много противников. От стандартных мечников, с одним видом атаки, до довольно быстрых и ловких оппонентов, с которыми вам придется попотеть. Есть и лучники, большие роботы с молотами, чертовы КАРАТИСТЫ - РОБОТЫ, огромные паукообразные гранатометчики, роботы с джетпаками и их вариации включительно! Заскучать вам не дадут. Челенджи здесь в меру сложны и не позволят вам потерять голову от безумной ярости, из-за того, что на вас выпустили 50 рапторов и 30 имбовых лучников и вы даже понять не успеваете, как вас сбивают рапторы и расстрелиивают лучники... Но это не точно. Есть система прокачки своего бойца, но она действует лишь на время прохождения, после смерти вы все теряете и возвращаетесь к самому началу. Челенджи могут блокировать вам доступ к определенным ветвям и возможностям, ибо это же челендж, но за их прохождения вы открываете новые способности, которые будут делать вашего робота еще более смертельным и опасным. Есть приятная мелочь в виде роботизированных комментаторов, которые отпускают колкости в сторону игрока и противников, ну и вообще выполняют свою работу - комментируют!) В игре порой происходит настоящий эпик, в этой игре - один в поле воин, да еще и какой! Простоту графики компенсируют эпичные схватки и накал страстей похлеще, чем в некоторых других играх. Что-то я разошелся, в итоге мы имеем очень простенькую игру, но сделанную со вкусом и душой. От меня - это не 10 из 10, но крепкая 8-ка.

Pros:

Good story mode
Infinite mode
Challenge modes
Special feature when watching people play on Twitch, like betting and spawning in troops.
Upgrades
Can be played offline
Injury accuracy
Kid friendly, because there is no blood only sparks

Cons: None

I have been playing this game since it came out on itch.io, and the developers keep on updating it to make it even better. It is a very fun game to play on long flights or when your internet is out, as this game can be played in offline mode. The amazing Twitch features makes it fun to watch people play it as well. I am a person who values the time you get out of the game and I believe for each dollar you spend you should get at least 1 hour of gameplay. This may just be me, but I have stuck to his philosophy for many games and most of them I enjoy and were time well spent. Do I think you could get 15 hours out of this game? Yes, but you really need to like this game. For an average player who just plays the story mode you would get around 4-6 hours depending on the person. I have played endless mode, workshop maps and even twitch mode. Those other games modes I have listed are very fun to do and now that they added the workshop you can in theory get 10's of hours of more game play just by playing those. Personally I enjoy the gameplay and the story of the game. If this game is 15 dollars and is released with the full story and all the modes they want to add I'd 100% say it is worth it, if you like games like paint the town red, I'd highly suggest this game to you. 

Pros: Fun machanics
Fun game play
Good controls
A good amount of difficulty
Workshop maps
Each update adds something new/needed to the game

Cons:
Story still not finished
Twitch mode feels like it is really lacking, spawning one or two enemies every few rounds is boring for both the player and the viewer. 
The updates are a few months a part and the story mode updates are even longer

Over all rating: 7/10
To sum it all up, this game is really fun to play on and off with the workshop maps, there are a few bugs since it is still in early access and the twitch mode isn't very fun. The story is pretty intresting and has a promising 4th chapter. An average player might not get 1 hour per every dollar they spend but it will get pretty close.

I got this game quite a while ago an unlike other Early Access games out there the developers of this game actually update it regually with big updates such as challenge modes and whole new sections of the 'campain'.

It's most basically a sword fighting game although you control your swings which isn't too common but you see in games such as Mount & Blade and the dead For Honor but it comes down to never using the downards swing since it has such a small hit box while the side to side swing. And with the weapons, unlike just being a large stick that you swing and it does X damage, they actually matter where they hit. Since your player and the enemies are voxel based they take damage depending on where they get hit. You or them get hit in the leg and you'll be hopping around like a slow moving idiot. Get your arm cut off and you'll be more easily stunned when a bad guy blocks your attack.

They added in a few new abilities and weapons from when I first got this game, such as the hammer, flaming weapons and things like the jetpack. But just with the hammer I breezed through things since the bad guys can't block a hammer swing and it's pretty much an instant kill no matter where you hit them since if you hit them in the legs they lose them both and die instantly and if you hit them in the side they die instantly. The only downside is that the hammer swings a tad slow and you can't block arrows with the hammer but if you just zig zag you can dodge them easiliy enough. But because there's such a varity of bad guys in the game it means you have to change tactics with each one like with the jetpack doods or Spindertrons. Don't get me even started with Spindertron!

While there isn't too much with the story you still get attached to your characters with nothing but a name, age and favourite colour. Although it seems I'm always stuck with people who are 80+ in age which does take away from it a tad. It takes place in the future where robots have taken over the universe and enjoy killing and tormenting humans by putting their minds in robotic bodies and having them fight other robots in The Danger Zone. You're a clone of the human in a drone. You could say you play A Clone Drone in the Danger Zone...

Okay that wasn't that funny...

But as you play through either the story or challenges you have two comintators judging you and maing fun of you in an over the top way that makes it enjoyable and even more fun than the gameplay already is. All in all this game has so much potental with the story finishing up and it coming out of early access and even at this point its a really fun game that is really worth getting if you get the chance.

(Note that my playtime is low, but I've played a lot of this but mainly in offline mode where steam doesn't think it counts and I played it before it was even on steam.)

35323398.review:
This is one of those games where you see it in the store and say, "That game looks okay." 

But when you play it, you see how good the game really is. I can't recommend this game enough. That gameplay is so smooth and responsive. Most of the time, your deaths feel entirely your fault as you fail to predict your enemy's movement or misjudge your spacing as you get barely clipped by the edge of a sword. Clone Drone is one of the best examples of the "just 5 more minutes" kind of games. As soon as you lose a run, you are instantly thrown straight into a new match with a blank character.

Doborog Games is an amzing developer with true passion. They are always listening to community feedback. When people complained that chapter 3 was too easy, in about a week or so, they added more, harder diffuculties.

At the time of writing this, they have just completed the amazing chapter 3 of the story mode and are already hard at work on chapter 4. I can't wait to see what they will do with this game in the future.

P.S. This game includes a level editor and Workshop support. There are some pretty awesome levels and challenges being made by the comminuty, very frequently if I might add.

The short Version:
It's a great casual game that has a lot of potential and is worth the money.

The in-depth version:

Clone drone in the danger zone is a indie fighting game where you play as humans who's minds are put into robot bodys. There are 4 modes to this game.

 [spoiler] There is story mode where you fight robots and try to escape the arena. [/spoiler]

There is also the endless mode where you fight robots till you die. There is also a variation of endless where there are challenges set and if you finish them you get trophies and some special abilitys.

The main reason you should buy this game is for what is to come as there is great potential for this game and they are adding new features on the 29th of september (2017)

34492686.review:
If you are a fan of perma-death, upgrades and robot jokes, look no further. Clone Drone is very well made (with a few issues) and can soak up your time. Be warned, however, you will be frustrated during your journey into this game, but not due to any glitches or technical issues.

Your human-bot is fragile. 
Any significant damage to your head will kill you.
Lost both arms and have no kick? Dead.
Take an arrow to the wrong area of your chest? Dead.
Shot an arrow at a level 3 sword-bot at too close a distance? D-e-a-d.
Lost a leg to some jetpack-bots and can't move far? Might as well be dead.

Some people hate that kind of thing, but I'm a glutton for punishment, so I loved it. 

The next thing you should know is that there are several ways to play; there is the Story Mode, the 'classis' Endless Mode and the Challenge Modes.

Story Mode is unfinished as of this review, but the developers are currently working on it, and it is a great way to introduce yourself to the concepts of the game. 

Endless Mode is just that, endless. Each of your human-bots are pitted against an endless supply of more and more difficult arenas that you have to survive (or die and use a clone to survive).

Challenge Modes will put you through a set amount of arenas with restrictions, such as bow-only, hammer-only and kick-only. There is also Steam Workshop support, so if you're into creating challenges to torture others, you can, or if you're a masochist like me you can take on those challenges.

The gameplay starts simple but complicates in varying degrees. You start with a lazer sword and the movement speed of a Jazzercising grandmother, but each successfully completed level grants you one upgrade. You can choose to make your sword a fire sword which gradually burns away bits of your enemies for a bleed-like effect, or give yourself a bow, which gives you a slow-moving but effective projectile at dispatching enemy archers and flame raptors (No, that's not a typo).

Alternatively you can use the upgrade points to create 'clones' of your human-bot. These serve as your extra lives, and you are limited to 5 total per run. Period. Recently the developers added a 'repair' function as well that you can spend your well-earned point on.

The upgrade point system is where some will get frustrated, and others intrigued. For example, do I risk not having a clone for the start of the Gold-difficuty levels and buy the booster-style jetpack, or do I play it safe in case I get ambushed in the next level and die? The wrong choice could end your run, but then again, your personal skill will do you in just as quickly.

Since this game is Early Access, I can only imagine that things will expand and get better as time moves on. There aren't many gamebreaking glitches to speak of, so the real make-or-break factor for this title is taste: The concept and gameplay of this game is a love-or-hate ordeal, so watch the gameplay before you buy.

34456924.review:
Guess its time to write down my review of the game. 
I played the living hell out of it, managed to beat every challenge and a lot of community challenges aswell.

Before i get started, everyone who doesnt enjoy reading, i recorded every single bit of it and uploaded my commentary to YT here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TY9H_jsai9M&list=PLMYAv8aq_acHxs1KqrC4XtubjMjoNmoV5


Now lets get started shall we?

Pros:
-Quirky and charming graphic
-Pretty good combat system, with great "slice" physics
-Engaging storyline (only 2 chapters at the moment unfortunately)
-Pretty funny commentators
-Great level builder
-A lot of different enemy types that require different strategies

Cons:
-Updates tend to be a bit slow, not enough communication from the developers
-Commentators are a lot of fun at the beginning, but it gets repetitive and annoying
-Combat animations are still a bit bugged from time to time, so you can get hit when you shouldnt
-Missing a robot customization, but that is a personal preference
-AI tends to be a bit stupid, jumping into the lava. I beat levels without doing a single hit


Conclusion:
The game offers a lot of potential, with the good combat system that allows you to slice enemys apart and cripple them, you might have a lot of fun. The levels are well designed, and some challenges are really hard to beat so you have to make up a good strategy. Thanks to the level editor and the workshop, you get an infinite flow of challenges to beat. Unfortunately, i've been waiting for the third story chapter quite a while now... and there isnt any sign of it coming soon. That is the only reason why i have mixed feelings about this game. After all, it was worth the 20 bucks and i had a great time.


TL;DR:
Freaking jedi robots and flame spitting robot dinosaurs!

34409505.review:
The core combat gameplay, itself is quite good, if a bit stiff.  Timing and positioning is extremely important, which is fun.  And how easy it is to die adds to the tension.  But I'm sick and tired of the "roguelike" trend that seems to think that unbalanced difficulty is a substitute for longevity, content and a good game design.  

If this game would embrace is core combat and expand on it and add depth to it, and at least partially mitigate the "get hit once and start all over again" roguelike element, I would definitely find it easy to recommend it.  As it is, I would only recommend it conditionally - if the person I was recommending it to liked roguelikes.  It doesn't have to be limited to people who enjoy roguelikes, it has a lot of promise - if it would embrace what's best about itself.  

Add depth and features (more maneuverability, more weapon types, co-op) and true replayability (more procedurally generated content, multiplayer PvP, more levels, more modes) and it could realize that potential, IMO.

33823305.review:
For fans of Jedi Knight 2: Jedi Outcast and Jedi Academy. You will find that the combat is very similar in this game. For anyone who wants a game with solid melee mechanics, I wholeheartedly recommend this one.

Pros:
♥ Very challenging at times. You will need to make the correct decisions about upgrading in the challenge modes
♥ Some funny dialogue from the commentators
♥ Fun upgrades, particularly for the sword and bow
♥ A lot of fun enemies to fight
♥ Great and reliable combat system

Cons:
♥ The story mode gets a bit repetetive. I get that's the point, but going through the early levels again & again is a bit tiresome. To be clear, once you clear a certain number, you do get a "checkpoint," so no need to go through the WHOLE game again. 
♥ Some upgrades feel more viable than others, which tend to just go ignored. For example - the hammer, despite its cool ability, feels supremely inferior to the sword.
♥ Some higher level enemies (such as the raptor or hammer bots) don't feel very challenging. Probably dependent on playstyle though. 
♥ A bit more music variety would be nice, as the combat track does get somewhat repetetive after a while.

All in all, well worth the money, in my opinion.

33780580.review:
Deffinetly worth it.

The game is about fighting different kinds of robots in various arenas.
After each won round you get an upgrade point to put into a skill or weapon and their upgrades - so far sword, hammer and bow. But you can also use jetpacks, kicks, flame breath... That being said, you can defeat any level without a single upgrade, in theory.
Upgrades help, add to your tactics (some weapons are better against some opponents), but you can use just a basic sword and environment to your advantage - sawblades, spikes, lava... Having Kick ability can be very handy in that regard. But the environment can be used against you, too.
Everything is voxel based, so you can dismember (and be dismembered) during fights. It's cute to see those huge hammer bots skipping after you after you cut off one of their legs. And it's oddly satisfactory to cut off legs of spider bots bit by bit.
Completing challenges unlocks additional weapon upgrades (fiery weapons), which at first look just like a visual improvement, but in fact make them much more powerful.
Also, Steam workshop levels added, brings in some freshness to the game.

In short: buy it, try it, you won't regret it.

One thing it lacks - multiplayer. Devs, please add multiplayer, would be awesome.

33291787.review:
70分钟通了现有的故事模式，目前剧情流程偏短。但各种模式和创意工坊能大大延长游戏时间。
游戏打斗很赞，剑的格挡、对敌人躯体的切割以及对弓箭的弹反都挺带感。除了靠武器击杀，利用敌人的友伤以及地形杀既是降低难度，同时也是挺有乐趣的过程。
游戏目前处于ea阶段，所以有很多地方可以改进完善：
一是技能树比较简单，而且在两章的故事模式里，因为技能点的有限和有些技能成形慢，导致技能树利用率较低，点上必备的格挡冲刺火焰就可以无脑克隆加命了。
可能是因为目前各种元素还不完全，锤子以及某些技能难有用武之地，技能构筑也基本是那几个套路。
二是敌人，武器等要素的丰富度偏低。
三是场景地形、陷阱种类比较少，限制了关卡编辑器的潜力。
如果能解决这些问题，那可玩性就大大增加。
最后不得不提创意工坊，丰富的挑战和无尽关卡极大延长游戏时间，而且目前做的人还不少。在游戏元素丰富后，工坊的潜力必然会提升一个档次。

33256547.review:
Its a pretty good game and I really recommend it, But your not in the reviews section to look at reviews, Your here to learn a ravioli recipe, so I gotchu covered:

Ingredients
- To Make the Dough
375 grams (3 cups) plain flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil
1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) water
Extra flour for dusting 


- To Make Cheese Filling
15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese
5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan, Romano & Asiago)
Note: grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.
1/2 cup cheddar cheese
2 eggs, lightly beaten
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper


- Extras
Your favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)
Parmesan cheese
Basil
Fried vegetables
Shrimp
Fish slices
Chicken pieces 
Make the Ravioli filling.

- In a small mixing bowl, add the ricotta and mash with a fork.
- Add in the 3-cheese blend, Cheddar cheese, eggs, salt, and pepper.
- Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth, paste-like consistency.
- Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. 

Make the Ravioli dough.

- Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water, oil, and salt. Mix.
- Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs, water, oil, and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed.
- Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough.
- Take the dough out of the mixing bowl, shape it into a ball, and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic.
- Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick, or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters.
- With a cookie cutter or upside-down water glass, cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15-20 dough circles).
- Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis, or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn’t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. 

Fill the Ravioli shells.

- Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough.
- Fill a small bowl with water, dip your fingers in, and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle.
- Fold the dough in half over the filling, making a half-moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a “homemade” touch as well.
- Repeat this process for all your dough circles.
- Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. 

Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker.

- Roll the dough into two sheets
- Place one sheet on the ravioli maker, and form the filling cups.
- Fill with the ravioli mixture.
- Lay the second sheet of dough on top, and roll it out. This will seal in the filling.
- Remove and separate the finished raviolis.

Cook the Ravioli.

- Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.
- Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5-6 minutes, or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test.
- If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time, you can freeze the rest 
- Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed plates

Serve it up.
Top with your favorite sauce, grate some fresh cheese over it, and enjoy!

32655197.review:
Clone Drone in the Danger Zone, an early access at the moment of writing with good potential.

PLOT:
Your a harvested human in a robot and can only fight for survival. You can between every level upgrade your gear/abilaty or make a clone (hint in tittle) so if you die in the arena you can return and don´t need to start all over again... couse that´s what´s gonna happen if you don´t. Spolier shown in the trailer.

PLAYSTYLE:
At the moment you have a few different categories of playstyles to chose from:
Story:
Playing through levels of differnet difficulties and somewhere find a story (not like AAA kind of story but a understandeble story).
SPOILERS: The story isn´t completed yet.

Chalenges:
Playing through levels of different difficulties but with at twist depending on what chalenge you chose. Most of them are for a specific weapon which will unlock cool abileties conected to that weapon after completed the whole series of levels (10 - 14 levels).

Twitch mode:
Pretty obvious, but in simple terms; you play with your stream and the viewers can chose which enemis will come next or choose your upgrades (never trust your viewers in this mode >:D).

HOW IT FEELS PLAYING
It feels pretty solid but has a few bugs that are sometimes funny to experience. It has a few frame drops at certain placese but that might just be my pc (a high preformence pc...)

CONCLUSION:
It´s a good blocky-indie-fighting-game with funny comentary by robots who can´t be killed (yes I have tried) and has it´s charm when playing.
I do deffenetly recomend this game at full price when it´s completed...
But at the moment the game is in the summer sale with a 33% off so you could save some bucks on it now as well.

Still your choise and not mine but I think you should if you like what you see in those trailers above this review. they are showing real gameplay.

Can you save humanity from beeing harvested and put into robots to only fight against other robots for someones plesure which we don´t really know who it is?

If you buy this game you can...

What it does right:
[list]
[*]Engaging gameplay.
[*]Skillful combat.
[*]Fun upgrades.
[*]Level editor.
[*]Funny commentators.
[*]Variety (Bow, sword, and a giant hammer!)
[/list]

What it does wrong:
[list]
[*]No modding support! D: (The devs have indicated they are thinking about how to approach it, which is a good sign! But they haven't gone and said it is going to happen 100%, so we have to wait for that to come out, if at all.)
[*]No proper tutorial. The first levels are easy enough on campaign, but aren't really a tutorial.
[*]Having to invest skill points into extra lives on the challenges. You're either so good at the game that you don't need extra lives for the challenges or you're not and you lose valuable upgrade points to gimp yourself for the next fight because of buying clones. (I understand that there's a give and take, but I feel that skipping out on an upgrade for an extra life really doesn't help people that need it.)

32279820.review:
So where to begin. This game is really fun and offers a lot in what it already has. The ability to slice enemies in half is very satisfying and with the addition of photo mode, you are able to set up really cool shots. It is still early in development and many features are still being added. However, there are still many things that do hold this game back. Some of which are very hard to control. As it is now, I would definitely recommend this game. It is fun and very playable even. I play games in waves and will play a game until I lose interest. This game has been one of the very few that is fun to go back to and play fro a while.

For this review it is important to take in all the factors that may alter the game. As far as I know (please correct me if I'm wrong) there are only 2 dedicated developers who work directly on the game. With that in mind they have lives and deserve to take breaks. Though they did make this commitment to the community they should in now way feel obligated to give up their entire life. 

I would also like to say I am just a customer who wants to know what I think. Keep that in mind that everyone has different preferences and you might find something wrong or great about the game that I didn't. I am not trying to tell you to buy this game, I just want to give you my opinion to help with your decision.

Pros:
- Addicting game play that is fun to both play and watch
- Passionate developers that want to help the best they can and want to talk with the customers
- Twitch mode allows for streamers to be challenged by the viewers and adds a bit of unpredictability to the game mode
- The workshop is a great place to see what people are making and adds something different to mix things up. The new update that adds color customization adds so much more. It allows you to make the map truly how you see it.
- The enemies in the game offer a wide verity of obstacles that allow for experimentation with which ones work well together
- The Game play is different from other many other games that gives a unique and clever game that has the violence and fighting as many hand to hand combat games but in a cartoonist and child friendly way
- the commentators are funny and have a wide variety of comments so that it doesn't become repetitive after a while
- flameraptors are really fun. They have a lot of potential and are hard to beat if you don't know their weakness. this leads me to the con though. The bow makes the flameraprots easy. this might have been on purpose but I think it should be a little harder.

Cons:
- There are bugs that are not all bad or that big but do sometime take away from the games experience
- (as of now) story mode is very interesting and has a lot of potential but is still in development and not that long. As of now the two chapters are very similar except with different enemies and a different ending. The ending of the second chapter is interesting and makes me excited to see what will happen next. 
- There are still some balancing issues that should be fixed such as the bow. It is a great weapon once you get fire arrows and slow time but at a certain point is still no mach for the sword
- The hammer is great in my opinion and has good damage to wield-ability but doesn't have as much depth as it could. I think there should be more ways it can interact with enemies.
- kickbot only because they have killed me so many times and have been the end of many endless mode runs. (yes I am still salty) the only other thing with these is maybe having a different kind.

Some bugs that one person points out may not have happened yet to another or might be a rare occurrence. If you find a bug please let the developers know because that shows how prevalent it is and has a higher chance of being acknowledged.

Overall the Game is great and is ever improving. If you can look past some of the fixes that exist in a lot of games than it is really fun and addictive. As with every rating, don't use this as the deciding factor and even though I would highly recommend the game, know that you and I are different and you won't fully know until you play for yourself. If this game doesn't interest you now but looks kind of fun, keep checking on it because that one little update could be what you were looking for. Thank you for your time and no matter who you are I hope you an amazing day.

31798905.review:
This is one of those games where, if you practice enough to get good, you can make a lot of progress. Then, you inevitably lose to something foolish. finally, when you start back at the beginning, the enemies at this point are so different in regards to how accurate they are and how fast they can attack. it's almost impossible to go from the silver tier back down to bronze and make any progress after. So basically, unless you are already in a good mood or have infinite patience, this game will be fun-right up until you make the smallest error. Then you lose a limb, which takes away any upgrades that you've already purchased that utilize that limb. If you survive that round, then to get your limbs and upgrades back you must forfeit your next upgrade to purchase a clone. 
These are just issues I've noticed playing. It seems to me that too much emphasis is placed on the importance of purchasing clones, rather than upgrades that you can then learn to use to survive longer. My recommendation to the programming team; maybe repair the player's robot between matches? or maybe just replace 1 missing limb?
I very much like how balanced the gameplay is and that the game runs very smoothly, and would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes arena-style gameplay; just make sure that you're in a good mood, because every mistake is punished severely...

砍效果特别棒也比较考验操作技术方才通关给大家说一下通关技巧：
 
其实挺简单的高玩上手之后很容易就通关了

这个游戏主要的强化自己的方法是点技能，武器也是点出来的分别为

锤子，弓箭和脚（没错，就是脚），如果用弓箭的话不要直接点弓箭，

要先点两格能量槽可能是游戏制作团队没注意原因初始一格能量槽连

弓箭都切不了。用弓箭一定要点瞄准时慢动作和升级能量槽回复速度

但是我建议不要用弓箭，更新后AI提高了风骚的走位还会跳。

锤子没升到最大前就不要用容易死并且锤子有大约三秒的延迟预判的

火剑→喷气背包→90°格挡箭→克隆→克隆→克隆........就这么简单，

虽然目前版本只有两章一共20关，不过还有挑战模式和无尽，据说无

尽很无聊-。-，可挑战是真的难，打了俩小时一个都没完成~~(>_<)~~

好了，我要继续打挑战了，希望各位读了我的评论能有所帮助

I really enjoy this game, although there are some problems that I'd like to mention.

The worst problem with this game is that sometimes I get nipped by an arrow or a basic energy sword and still end up dying.

Some challenges could be impossible to complete mattering on which upgrades you invest into. 
An example of this would be the bow challenge. If Mark 3 or 4 sword robots are spawned you wouldn't be able to kill them without the kick upgrade because they just deflect all of your arrows. Even if you do have the kick upgrade, it's still risky getting close enough to a high ranking robot such as a Mark 3 or 4 robot to kick them down. Even when you kick the robot down, it's still difficult to land a killing blow with an arrow because the Mark 3 and 4 robots get up very quickly.

But overall, I really recommend this game to people who are fans of arena fighting games.

31108264.review:
I got this game for $9.99 before it came to steam (so pay no attention to my underwhelming hours), but even at this slightly higher price, I would strongly recommend this game. It is, hands down, one of the best third-person games I've ever played. The story mode, while uncomplete, provides an interesting tale to the game. However, the main attraction for this game, at least for me, are the other modes- endless, twitch, and challenge, possibly with more to come. Endless mode has tons of levels that get more and more challenging. Upgrades and original levels keep it fresh. Kudos to the twitch viewers for the duck? The twitch and challenge modes are also very interesting and fun. All in all, this game is an experience that is well worth your time and money.

10/10

30893151.review:
Clone Drone in the Danger Zone is an arena fighter game where you're pitted against AI in an arena filled with enemies and traps. While at first it seems simple, the combination of the different enemies soon turns it into a battle of quick reactions and tactical use of your available weapons. The story mode provides a good tutorial into the game by being moderately difficult, abeit rather short with only 2 chapters (more to come). The main chunk of the gameplay comes from challenge mode and endless mode, with twitch mode being obviously something that only twitch streamers would sink time into, though it is definitely a fun mode as well.

Endless mode is basically just the player versus wave after wave of robots, following the same structure as the story mode. After each wave you return to your lobby and use a skill point to upgrade your robot. The maps come in groups of bronze, silver, gold, diamond and titanium with each map either being one shared between them all with an increase in enemy tier or a map unique to that difficulty. The enemies slowly progress as the game goes on to increase the variety and while it is more common to see the tier 3 and 4 enemies towards titanium, lower tiers can still appear as well to sneak in a cheeky killing blow while your guard is down. One of the best parts of this mode is the combination of the enemies which forms a formidable force to fight against. For example, a single Mark 3 Sword Robot might be easy to handle on it's own, but add any archer bot to the mix and suddenly you can have an arrow that you dodged deflected into your back by the sword robot. Another example of this was a kick bot knocking me into the swing of a hammer, perfectly positioning me for the killing blow. The interaction between the enemies results in random and interesting fights each time you play.

The second time sink mode is Challenge Mode. This requires the player to follow handicaps such as using the hammer or bow only, as well as other ones such as random (clone always) upgrade challenge where the upgrade is randomly selected for you, forcing you to (respawn a lot) change your playstyle according to (how many clones you got) what skills you were given. It's a fun mode and it even rewards you with bonus abilities that can be used in endless mode as well as a cool statue in your lobby area.

I've followed this game since it was on itch.io and it's been fantastic. For an EA game it is quite solid and I've rarely run into any bugs that have broken the game. The content gets updated regularly so that it feels like you have something significant to come back to whenever you see this game has a patch. With the recent addition of photo mode it's also a blast just to try and show off to get a cool looking photo. Overall this is a fantastic game that is well worth the money and time.

Review 4.0:
Since the last review, Flame raptors were added, the community has also went to legitimate $hit, as of now, a group of trollers are shredding the hard work of a select few level builders, because it affects me and there is nothing being done about it, i simply cannot under any circumstance, give the game a posative review given the state of the forums.
------------------------------
section 1: content breakdown
------------------------------

The level editor in itself is well built, less unpredictible and generally rounded well, but it alone is not a full package, the workshop its connected to is litteral garbage, try as hard as you want to make nice content, simply putting up ret@rded spam is going to make you more popular anyway, dont waste your time or effort with this feature, it is a waste of time.

The main game functions perfectly well, though performance could still be optimised.

Intergration features work perfectly well, however they are being exploited by a select few individuals.

------------------------------
section 2: community and developers
------------------------------

There isnt much to say about the developers, eric is as stuborn and simple minded as ever, the other two developers build a game, its fine, its what youd expect, but unfortunetly, the community is more than developers...

The twitch communites growth is negative, the viewer averages across the day are decreasing, (foreign streams do not count- being streams that dont regularly visit), as for the viewers, well they are viewers, they reflect the community, and it really shows when you stream, the average age given is <13, which is probably why it is unfavorable to stream this game

The workshop is the biggest faliure the game has, underused, underprotected and ultimetly ignored, full of spam, creative property being stolen, rude content, and generally a poor attitude, its had its day, its allready dying.
------------------------------
section 3: bullet points overview (pros vs cons)
------------------------------

Pros:
----
*has twitch intergration
*level editor itself is good
*is value for money (£1>5H playtime)
*features a unique concept
*commentary is good quality
*reliable generally
----

Cons:
----
*Still highly buggy
*Community has degraded below anything i am willing to deal with
*Community numbers are dying off
*Overall interest on external sites is almost non-existant
*Content creators ignore the workshop due to its ridiculously low quality given its potential
*Level ratings are not based on quality
*Lack of tournements
*Underused forum
*Lack of showcases for "high quality items"
*Hostile users
*Low user age
*Non-diverse content created due to a lack of workshop compatibility with twitch mode
*enourmous memory issues with spidertrons
*various other breakages with enemies and their AI
*currently more than 100+ listed bugs
*extremely poor performance given simplicity
*level editor is shackled with restrictions and a poor camera
----
Conclusion

As hard as the developers try, if they continue to ignore the community, the game will rot inside out before it is even given a full story, if i were them, id make a botched exit and abandon it in its current state as a failed project, it attraced the wrong mixes of crowds, and the community fell apart due to a lack of moderation, remember, numbers arnt everything, quality is needed too.
---------------
overall ratings
Endless gameplay: 9/10 (Almost garunteed reliability and a good vannila level spread for titanium, though still needs a higher challenge for titanium)
Community and developers: 0.5/10 (Uncensored, full of spam, an utter joke in its current state)
Level editor: 5/10 (Editor is perfect, the workshop connected to it isnt)
Workshop: 0/10 (Physically unusable, spam ridden, full of trolls and "review bombs", not worth using)
Intergration: 6/10 (More work needed to make levels twitch compatible)
Reliability: 6/10 (Though the game can reliably be played, it lack of solidity with blocks quickly unravels a large ammount of issues)
Compatibilty: 4/10 (memory leaks with tabs has become almost unbearable, if you want to use the game, make sure its the only thing open and you dont click out of it)
----------

Global Overall Rating: 2.5/10 (Only usable in singleplayer without the workshop, Genrally poor)

30743457.review:
游戏很好玩，可以娱乐也可以秀操作，难度其实只要玩一段时间操作熟练了就没那么高了。英语文本难度不高，基础水平就可以读懂。很值得入手。顺便说一下kick真的很好用

-------------------------------------------------------------
May 5th
在这里给想玩弓箭流的玩家一些建议，在升级方向上（关于clone、sword、kick、jet pack的选择我会在后面说明这些选项对于弓箭流的取舍，在以下流程中我不会加入这些选项）
no fire arrows:bow--------arrow width 1--------arrow width 2-------energy capacity 1------energy capacity 2-----energy recharge 1----------energy recharge 2---------energy capacity 3--------aim time 1------aim time 2 

'fire arrows' is allowed:bow-----fire arrows 1-------arrow width 1--------energy capacity 1------energy capacity 2-----energy recharge 1----------energy recharge 2--------fire arrows 2 / arrow width 2--------fire arrows2 / arrow width 2-energy capacity 3--------aim time 1------aim time  2

在此介绍一下上述流程中各主要技能的作用：

1、arrow width 1 / 2 :在你还未拥有火箭之前，有时会遇到一箭射不死人的尴尬情况，这多半是由于没有射到致命部位导致的。要想避免这种情况，要么苦练技术最终招招爆头，要么就是升级弓箭的宽度。简而言之，这个选项就是提高每一发的容错率，而且后期敌人有的体型变大后，小箭往往没什么作用。

2、fire arrows 1 / 2 :火焰作为游戏中伤害极高的能力，配合远距离输出的弓箭可以发挥极大的作用。有了火箭后，你可以不必拘泥于爆头或是砍腿，一旦命中有时就意味着敌人的死亡。强大不需要解释。

3、energy recharge 1 / 2 :很多人可能会喜欢直线点满能量槽，但其实能量恢复所带来的收益有时候远大于能量槽。高手有多个能量槽后可以开局就大肆屠杀，而普通人选择能量恢复可以一定程度上弥补弓箭受限于能量的攻击间隔，从而提高生存能力。

4、aim time 1 / 2 :这个技能实际上是弓箭流比其他流派更有优势的一个很大原因，只点一点可能没什么感觉，但是升到二级后你能够确确实实地感觉到时间凝固了！在这个子弹时间中，你可以非常轻松的瞄准敌人的头部、脚部、甚至拿着武器的手！你也可以及时观察周围然后对下一步行动作出判断。但是这个技能被放在最后升级，主要原因就是超高的能量消耗，在没有点出recharge前用这个技能很容易导致出现攻击的真空期。点出recharge之后这个影响就会小很多。

下面说一下几个额外的选项

1、clone :很多人喜欢在点出一些技能后立刻大批量克隆，实际上这是不可取的。这个行为会导致你在面对下一波敌人时会有更大的压力，如果一定要在所有技能学完的期间进行克隆，我推荐穿插在能量槽2和能量槽3之间的那个时段。

后续我会继续更新………………

30742224.review:
I just love this game. It has funny dialogue, a decent combat system, and a pretty large variety of upgrades. Each robot human has their own occupation, age, and favorite color, which may not seem like anything important, but still adds diversity to the game.The controls work after getting used to them. You can lose almost every body part and still keeping working.(losing limbs may provide disadvantages.) One thing that I found out about this game is the strategies. They change based on your experience in the game, until you form the most efficient techniques. I love how rage inducing and comedic this game can be. To explain my feelings toward this game, I will divide my text into four sections.(Useful info: the arena has five tiers, which are bronze, silver, gold, diamond, and titanium.) (Also, if you hate long text, then stop reading.)

Story Mode- (without spoilers) This mode is a good introduction to the game. It contains an adequate difficulty curve and the story serves its purpose to make you continue. The basic rundown is that humans are being harvested, humans are being used for gladitorial entertainment, and you can not escape. Until they update this even more (I know the game is early acces) it will not contain the most playtime in the game. (but still check it out)

Twitch Mode- Beforehand, let me notify you that I am not a twitch streamer. This mode is the most multiplayer esc mode. One person will livestream this and the viewers can bet on the streamers death, spawn enemies, and can make the crowd put out emojis. (the different robots sitting in the arena have emojis over their head) Also, the viewers can give the streamer clones.(max five) They can also bet on which tier they die on. This is a jam packed mode, but the viewers can be relentless. The streamer will almost always die before gold tier. This may need some balancing, but please note that I haven't done this mode.

Endless mode- Probably the best mode. (This or challenge mode) This is an endless gamemode (hence the name) that will progress you through the 5 tiers. The titanium tier will go on forever until you die. Each level you beat gives you one upgrade. (As goes everymode, I forgot to say this) Endless mode contains a fair difficulty curve, until you reach titanium. When you reach titanium, the game doesn't get any harder, which kinda sucks. This doesn't matter because titanium still is really difficult. You can test out strategies, mess around, or get serious and aim for a pb. (Mine is titanium 44, I beat 43 with one missing leg and another VERY small stub leg, oh, and a missing arm, quite a formidable score.) I spent probably the second most amount of time on this mode. (This will change because I will always go back to this mode). I highly recommend getting this game just for this mode.

Challenge mode- I LOVED this. The challenges had variety and I would love more. Challenge mode currently contains four challenges. 1. The Inferno Challenge- In order to obtain (one of the best perks) flame breath, you must go through 10 stages of fierceful, flaming enemies that give you no room for error. This challenge was exciting and pretty difficult. For me this was the easiest, but for others, this seemed like the second hardest. 2.Random Upgrade Challenge- This one is all on the RNG and can be very rage inducing. I personally felt that this challenge was the hardest and took me the longest. I  decided to watch a video of someone trying it and laugh at them. (They beat it in their second try :(   ) This just gives you a trophy and is necessary for all of those completionists, so good luck ;). 3. Bow only Challenge- This challenge is self explanatory, you can only use a bow. Bow only is one of the most gamechanging challeges because some bots can block arrows.(you will find out how to kill those) The general opinion seems to be that this is the hardest challenge and I can agree. You will develop new strategies and manage to (not) make it to the top. Beating this gives you flame arrows, probably the worst of the 3 unlockable upgrades.(It isn't a bad upgrade, just the worst of the 3) 4. Hammer Challenge- As expected, one may only use a hammer. This was a pretty easy challenge after getting the hammer controls down. The Hammer Challenge unlocks a flaming hammer, which is fun to go around and crush people with. Note:All of these challenges give you trophies that will be next to your upgrade station.

All in all, this game has the already great content and even better potential. I thank the developers and urge them to continue updating this masterpiece. (My apologies for any missed information and scattered thoughts.) Oh, and by the way, I know this is unexpected, but I recommend this game. "Such robot diversity"

Is it perfect? Of course not. But it's a cheap indie title that's a lot of fun and checks a lot of the right boxes. Not sure if it's for you? By all means, find a good twitch stream and participate in the mayhem!

30590166.review:
So I've followed this title on the top-seller list on [i]Itch.io[/i] for a loooong time. Now that it's on [i]Steam[/i] I had to see what all the fuss was about.
---

[b][i]Clone Drone in the Danger Zone[/i] likely gained popularity primarly from [i]Twitch[/i] streamers, which automatically puts it in a fringe category thats not my usual jam.[/b] By 'fringe' I suppose I am loosely referring to games that get lots of knee-slap laughs and are quick and relatively lite. There is a even an option in-game to play with [i]Twitch[/i] viewers interaction. I was also surprised to find that this title is only single player. 

[i]Essentially, this is an 'arena' game where you fight wave-after-wave of enemies of increasing difficulty.[/i] There is a small but digestible skill tree of upgrades you choose from between each wave. You can get things like a jetpack, a fire sword, the ability to kick, more energy, etc. The choices are small, but they are potent which is all that matters. There are bosses and slightly different level layouts. The controls are fun and work well. Another interesting aspect is that there are robot commentators that say all kinds of semi-random and fun stuff that keep it fresh. This part probably did well with the streamers.

Well, overall I found it enjoyable. I definitely see the appeal and will keep it, for sure. It's definitely something you play in short bursts. For instance, I've played for a mere 30-40 minutes before writing this, and that felt like a long time. That was over probably 6 play sessions. I enjoyed them all, but tire quickly after a burst.

The one thing that I have to say is that it probably isn't worth $15. Yeah, it is well done and it is [i]fun[/i], but I think a $10 tag would sit better with me. I think the content is kind of slim for $15. The skill tree is quite limited, and the combat is relatively simple. There is no controller support, either.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+It is fun. In fact, I think the trailer doesn't capture it well enough. You have to try this to actually [i]get[/i] the draw (or at least I did).
+While there isn't much content, what is there is high quality. For example the skill tree is small, but the choices all make for interesting strategies and all change how you play the game.
+Controls are good.
+Robot commentators are both funny and a nice addition. Interesting and novel idea for this kind of game.

[b]Cons:[/b]
-While it is well done, I think the price point is a tad high for the content offered. I think I'd like to see a bigger skill tree, different kinds of playable robots, and controller support.

[b]It's fun.[/b] If you find yourself on the fence, I bet you'd be glad you picked it up.

Clone Drone in the Danger Zone, is a third person sword fighter, as well as a: hammer, fire sword, fire bow and bow fighter! This game is set in an arena with robots that are there to kill you. I find this game brilliant and here is why :)

Audio - The music is tense and brings nice tension and BA emotions. I think the only thing i [b]HATE[/b] about this game in audio terms is the speaking of the spectators. They chat all the time. In all, I rate the audio, 5.5/10

Gameplay - This game is set in an arena with robots that are there to kill you. There are different robots. Jetpack Bots, Hammer Bots, Mark II Hammer Bots, Mark II Sword Bots, Mark I Archer bots, you get the jist of it. The goal of the game is simple. To try and get to the hardest arena and beat it. At the end of every sub-level of fighting, you go down an elevator and get a chance to get upgrades. This counts as getting an extra clone (life), getting kick mechanics, getting a bow or more! Maybe even a jetpack! This game is just slicing and dicing all the other competitors. There are traps to assist you too! Sawblades, Flame Throwers, Spikes, the lot! This game also has an Endless mode which proves that you can replay this game even after finishing it! This is a must buy game, if you want to feel like a robot slicing and dicing others! 

Graphics / Visuals - This game reminds me of the game Trove by the graphics used. Its better when you can slice up the competitors into little cubes, even after eliminating them!

+ Cool Cubed Graphics!
+ Awesome Replay Features
+ Difficult but fun
+ Twitch mode, for streamers vs viewers
+ Endless mode, NEVER GET TIRED OF THIS!
- Wish there was a way to stop hardcore so you can practice without permadeath. 

Overall, 8/10

30573585.review:
Clone Drone in the Danger Zone is a fun, creative game. The combat is voxel based, meaning damage is based entirely on where the weapon hits, rather than arbitrary numbers, which greatly adds to the immersion and combat. The weapons are varied, fun to use, and useful, while the enemies also provide a wide variety of challenges. That, combined with the sheer amount of levels, means that there is massive replayability. The announcers provide funny dialogue, which gives this game personality you'd be hard pressed to find elsewhere, and makes Clone Drone stand out from other games in the same genre. While the game is not entirely without bugs (it is still early access), it is completely stable, with very few bugs, none of them gamebreaking.

In addition to all that the game has to offer already, its community and its dev team is also excellent. The creator regularly streams development of this game, and takes suggestions and feedback form the chat. Doborog can also be found in forums, both here and on itch.io, where it was originally released. In fact, the hammer bots in game were originally conceived by the community. The community of this game is funny, creative, with some avid fanfic writers thrown in. In addition, the development speed of this game results in major updates every month or so, each one making the game better than the last, adding new features and changes. 


In conclusion, this is a magnificent game, with fast paced, fun, and varied combat, excellent humor, a great community and dev team, with a nice soundtrack to top it off. In other words, get it already.

30543677.review:
I'm just going to start off by saying that I've been playing Clone Drone on Itch.io since its inception, and it is HANDS DOWN, one of my favourite indie games of all time.

As a YouTuber, I go through games like your grandma goes through knickers. Ninety nine percent of the time, I'll never play any of those games ever again. If I do, it's only to make a video because "other" people seemed to enjoy it. Clone Drone in the Danger Zone is one of the very few games that I frequently return to to play for "myself". I absoulutely love this game.

So .. what makes it so good??

Well, when I'm searching for a game to play for my own enjoyment, there are usually a few main factors that I look for. Firstly, I want a casual game that doesn't require me to sit down and invest obscene amounts of time in order to get anything done. I want to hop on, be able to play for anywhere between 5 and 60 minutes, and come out feeling like I achieved something or that I simply had a good time. I want simple gameplay mechanics that are accessible to anyone, but also allow for deeper, more technical and strategic gameplay, for those that are more familiar with the game and are looking for a challenge. I want CUSTOMIZATION and UPGRADE trees! I want to be able to build my character in the way I want; adding the skills and abilities that I feel suit whatever approach I'm currently taking. I also want something that's aesthetically appealing, but most of all, I want a dopea$$ soundtrack to accompany this otherwise perfect concoction of game elements - and guess what?? Clone Drone has one of the BEST sountracks that I have ever heard in a game, EVER.

Even in its early stages over on Itch.io, Clone Drone has had unlimited replayability value since the implementation of its Endless Mode, and now with the latest update that brings Challenges and a whole bunch of other sweet bits and pieces, the future of Clone Drone is looking bloody brilliant. The developer is also insanely active in the community, regularly live streams the game's development as he does it, and is frequently adding new content to the game.

I honestly can't praise this game enough. Clone Drone in the Danger Zone is the bee's frickin' knees. Get it.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

On a side note, I did a short video covering some of the new things added in the latest update, and the Random Upgrades Challenge mode. You're welcome to check it out here -

https://youtu.be/B7XEXCpCVZ0

Cheers!

30542632.review:
Best Game Ever!
And here is why:

Clone Drone in the Danger Zone is a fast-paced arena brawler featuring voxel destruction of your enemies and, less commonly, yourself. Armed with 3 weapons each with different play styles, you take on the killer robots awaiting you in the arena. As you progress, you gain upgrades like a jetpack, or a clone that help you more efficiently dispatch the increasingly difficult enemies. 

Game Modes!

There is a developing story mode that is intriguing, but currently incomplete. (They are working on it, sometimes in front of you with dev streams) There are currently 2 chapters to play.

Endless Mode is what you probably will spend most of your time on. With so many levels, divided into 5 difficulties, you try and get as far as possible before your inevitable death. Can you reach Titanium?

I haven’t played the Challenges as of this review, but they contain various challenges to hone your skills. Hammer, Bow, Inferno, all of them provide a unique re-playability to the already awesome game.

Don’t forget Twitch Mode! That’s right, a mode designed for TWITCH STREAMING! This is, by far, the most difficult mode. So participate in killing the unfortunate streamer, or stream it yourself.

Clone Drone in the Danger Zone is always improving, with enemies, weapons and upgrades.  


TL;DR       Honestly it is the best game I have played and would recommend it to anyone.
        9.98/10

38991901.review:
[h1]This game is amazing.[/h1]
The story mode is rather short at the moment, but it's not done. The story itself isn't something you'd really look forward to beating, as it's pretty bland - being almost the same as endless mode, [i]until the third chapter that is[/i]. The story mode isn't all though, the challenges you can do to unlock more upgrades or just to challenge yourself are great (and not to mention the feeling when you finally beat that damn challenge). You've also got endless mode, which, as the name suggests, goes on until you die. The game is very hard, especially for inexperienced players, but somehow no matter how many times I've died I never get annoyed with the game or bored; instead I want to get farther then before. Despite the difficulty it manages to stay fun.

[b]I often find myself laughing at myself[/b] because I died doing something stupid, like trying to kick a MK3 sword robot into a pit of spikes rather then killing it. Or kicking a robot onto a jump pad, then trying to shoot it in mid air as it falls back down with a bow. Or running straight into a horde of sword robots to see if I can get them to kill eachother.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
The game is really fun, with damn near infinite replayability. The game is pretty hard at first, and has permadeath so if you like harder games I'd definitely recommend this.

38976503.review:
Combat Gameplay is amazing, commentatron and analysis bot are hilarious, and the (still evolving) story is interesting and (at least in chapter 3) makes clever use of the premise that your mind can be downloaded into a robot (or transferred between them).

However, I think the most effective part of the game is that each time you start a game, it gives you a (randomly generated?) name, former occupation, age, and robot color and another robot says your name out loud. The lists of each are apparently incredibly long. Your robot does a series of motions as they are hurtled toward their first arena bout, that communicate, in order: Sweet, I have a sword (up-beat) ; wait I'm a robot!>?!?!? (down-beat); I have no control over my fate (down-beat); well, I better do the best I can (up-beat).  No really, watch it closely. 

 Add to this  the ongoing storyline of the robot empire coming towards earth and harvesting human minds along the way, and it means that:

1) each robot you play as had a life that was shattered by being "harvested" by the robots.

2) each time commentatron and analysis bot mention previous "contestants" in the arena, they are referring to your previous playthroughs.

It generates, at a whole lot of different levels, buy-in and determination to overcome the game's pretty severe difficulty. You're doing it for yourself (both you as the player and you as the robot character), you're doing it to fight back against the robots, you're doing it to get revenge for your fallen fellow harvested humans, and you're doing it to save humanity. All wrapped up in the fact that you yourself are now a robot and probably cannot be saved.

Don't be fooled by the game's bright colors, hilarious commentary, and generally light tone. This game has way more dramatic depth than it appears. 

No really, I swear, this is all in the game's subtext.
